acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since 72 hours EC50 of the algae (Skeletonema) was more than the water solubility (EU-RAR (2003)), it was classified into Not classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of > 5,000mg/kg (EHC 162 (1994)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (1999) and Category C by EPA (1990).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although it is water-insolubility and acute toxicity was not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations and there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since the bio-accumulation (BCF<50 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Used as a flame retardant additive for polystyrene products etc. (HSDB, 2006)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.56 (2005), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.56 (2005), EU-RAR No.17 (2002) and NTP DB (Access on April 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures (Used as a flame retardant additive for polystyrene products etc. (HSDB, 2006)).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no definitive evidence of reproductive toxicity observed in reproductive toxicity studies and teratogenicity studies in rats and mice, described in NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.56 (2005) and CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.56 (2005).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (EHC 162 (1994), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.56 (2005)): "Animals treated with the substance showed only transient congestion and edema of the conjunctival membranes. These symptoms subsided by 24 hours," "At 24 hours, only slight redness (4 of 6), only slight edema (2 of 6), and only slight discharge (1 of 6) of the conjunctiva were noted." The substance is thus considered a mild eye irritant.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (EHC 162 (1994)): "The substance initially caused no irritation of the skin. After an observation period of 72 hours, slight erythematous and edematous responses were noted."

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the negative results in human skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-16 (1998) and EHC 162 (1994)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, thyroid)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "hypertrophy and vacuolization of centrolobular hepatocytes in the liver, renal tubular hyaline degeneration, and hyperplasia of the thyroid gland" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
